when_to_say: When greeting someone informally or formally.
example: ¡Hola! ¿Cómo estás? (ˈo.la! ˈko.mo esˈtas?) - Hello! How are you?

when_to_say: When parting ways with someone.
example: Adiós, hasta luego. (aˈðjos, ˈas.ta ˈlwe.ɣo) - Goodbye, see you later.

when_to_say: When making a polite request or asking for something.
example: Por favor, un café. (por faˈβoɾ, un kaˈfe) - Please, a coffee.

when_to_say: When expressing gratitude for something received or done.
example: Gracias por tu ayuda. (ˈɡɾa.sjas por tu aˈʝu.ða) - Thank you for your help.

when_to_say: When agreeing, confirming, or giving an affirmative response.
example: ¿Vienes? Sí, voy. (ˈbje.nes? si, βoi.) - Are you coming? Yes, I am.

when_to_say: When disagreeing, denying, or giving a negative response.
example: ¿Quieres más? No, gracias. (ˈkje.ɾes mas? no, ˈɡɾa.sjas.) - Do you want more? No, thank you.

when_to_say: When apologizing for a mistake or expressing regret.
example: Lo siento mucho. (lo ˈsjen.to ˈmu.tʃo.) - I'm very sorry.

when_to_say: As a response to 'thank you'.
example: Gracias. De nada. (ˈɡɾa.sjas. de ˈna.ða.) - Thank you. You're welcome.

when_to_say: When asking to pass, or for permission.
example: Con permiso. (kon peɾˈmi.so.) - Excuse me (to pass).

when_to_say: When greeting someone in the morning.
example: Buenos días a todos. (ˈbwe.nos ˈði.as a ˈto.ðos.) - Good morning everyone.

when_to_say: When greeting someone in the afternoon or early evening.
example: Buenas tardes, ¿cómo le va? (ˈbwe.nas ˈtaɾ.ðes, ˈko.mo le βa?) - Good afternoon, how are you?

when_to_say: When greeting someone in the late evening or saying good night.
example: Buenas noches, que descanses. (ˈbwe.nas ˈno.tʃes, ke ðesˈkan.ses.) - Good night, rest well.

when_to_say: When saying goodbye with the expectation of seeing someone later.
example: Me voy, hasta luego. (me βoi, ˈas.ta ˈlwe.ɣo.) - I'm leaving, see you later.

when_to_say: An informal way to ask how someone is doing.
example: Hola, ¿qué tal? (ˈo.la, ke ˈtal?) - Hi, how are you?

when_to_say: When referring to the liquid or asking for a drink.
example: Necesito agua. (ne.θeˈsi.to ˈa.ɣwa.) - I need water.

when_to_say: When referring to something to eat.
example: La comida es deliciosa. (la koˈmi.ða es ðe.liˈsjo.sa.) - The food is delicious.

when_to_say: When referring to a dwelling.
example: Mi casa es grande. (mi ˈka.sa es ˈɡɾan.de.) - My house is big.

when_to_say: When referring to an automobile (common in Spain).
example: Mi coche es nuevo. (mi ˈko.tʃe es ˈnwe.βo.) - My car is new.

when_to_say: When referring to a publication.
example: Me gusta leer libros. (me ˈɡus.ta leˈeɾ ˈli.βɾos.) - I like to read books.

when_to_say: When referring to a piece of furniture with a flat top.
example: Pon la mesa. (pon la ˈme.sa.) - Set the table.

when_to_say: When referring to a seat for one person.
example: Siéntate en la silla. (sjenˈta.te en la ˈsi.ʝa.) - Sit on the chair.

when_to_say: When referring to a communication device.
example: Mi teléfono está sonando. (mi teˈle.fo.no esˈta soˈnan.do.) - My phone is ringing.

when_to_say: When referring to currency or funds.
example: No tengo dinero. (no ˈteŋ.ɡo diˈne.ɾo.) - I don't have money.

when_to_say: When referring to employment or a task.
example: Tengo mucho trabajo. (ˈteŋ.ɡo ˈmu.tʃo tɾaˈβa.xo.) - I have a lot of work.

when_to_say: When referring to an educational institution.
example: Voy a la escuela. (boi a la esˈkwe.la.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: When referring to a higher education institution.
example: Estudio en la universidad. (esˈtu.ðjo en la u.ni.βeɾ.siˈðað.) - I study at the university.

when_to_say: When referring to a medical facility.
example: Está en el hospital. (esˈta en el os.piˈtal.) - He is in the hospital.

when_to_say: When referring to a place for air travel.
example: Vamos al aeropuerto. (ˈba.mos al a.e.ɾoˈpweɾ.to.) - Let's go to the airport.

when_to_say: When referring to a specific moment, duration, or weather conditions.
example: ¿Qué tiempo hace? (ke ˈtjem.po ˈa.θe?) - What's the weather like?

when_to_say: When referring to a single 24-hour period.
example: Es un buen día. (es un bwen ˈdi.a.) - It's a good day.

when_to_say: When referring to the period of darkness.
example: La noche es oscura. (la ˈno.tʃe es osˈku.ɾa.) - The night is dark.

when_to_say: When referring to the early part of the day or the next day.
example: Nos vemos mañana. (nos ˈβe.mos maˈɲa.na.) - See you tomorrow.

when_to_say: When referring to the current day.
example: Hoy hace sol. (oi ˈa.θe sol.) - It's sunny today.

when_to_say: When referring to the day before today.
example: Fui al cine ayer. (fwi al ˈθi.ne aˈʝeɾ.) - I went to the cinema yesterday.

when_to_say: When referring to a period of seven days.
example: La próxima semana. (la ˈpɾok.si.ma seˈma.na.) - Next week.

when_to_say: When referring to one of the twelve divisions of a year.
example: Este mes es largo. (ˈes.te mes es ˈlaɾ.ɣo.) - This month is long.

when_to_say: When referring to a period of 365 days.
example: Feliz año nuevo. (feˈliθ ˈa.ɲo ˈnwe.βo.) - Happy New Year.

when_to_say: When referring to the present moment.
example: Hazlo ahora. (ˈaθ.lo aˈo.ɾa.) - Do it now.

when_to_say: When referring to a subsequent time.
example: Hablamos después. (aˈβla.mos desˈpwes.) - We'll talk later.

when_to_say: When something occurs on every occasion.
example: Siempre te recuerdo. (ˈsjem.pɾe te reˈkweɾ.ðo.) - I always remember you.

when_to_say: When something does not occur at any time.
example: Nunca lo haré. (ˈnun.ka lo aˈɾe.) - I will never do it.

when_to_say: When something occurs occasionally.
example: A veces llueve. (a ˈβe.θes ˈʝwe.βe.) - Sometimes it rains.

when_to_say: When referring to a male companion.
example: Él es mi amigo. (el es mi aˈmi.ɣo.) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: When referring to a female companion.
example: Ella es mi amiga. (ˈe.ʝa es mi aˈmi.ɣa.) - She is my friend.

when_to_say: When referring to one's relatives.
example: Mi familia es grande. (mi faˈmi.lja es ˈɡɾan.de.) - My family is big.

when_to_say: When referring to one's female parent.
example: Mi madre es amable. (mi ˈma.ðɾe es aˈma.βle.) - My mother is kind.

when_to_say: When referring to one's male parent.
example: Mi padre trabaja mucho. (mi ˈpa.ðɾe tɾaˈβa.xa ˈmu.tʃo.) - My father works a lot.

when_to_say: When referring to a male sibling.
example: Tengo un hermano. (ˈteŋ.ɡo un eɾˈma.no.) - I have a brother.

when_to_say: When referring to a female sibling.
example: Mi hermana es menor. (mi eɾˈma.na es meˈnoɾ.) - My sister is younger.

when_to_say: When referring to a male child.
example: Mi hijo estudia. (mi ˈi.xo esˈtu.ðja.) - My son studies.

when_to_say: When referring to a female child.
example: Mi hija juega. (mi ˈi.xa ˈxwe.ɣa.) - My daughter plays.

when_to_say: When referring to one's paternal or maternal grandfather.
example: Mi abuelo es viejo. (mi aˈβwe.lo es ˈβje.xo.) - My grandfather is old.

when_to_say: When referring to one's paternal or maternal grandmother.
example: Mi abuela cocina. (mi aˈβwe.la koˈθi.na.) - My grandmother cooks.

when_to_say: When referring to one's mother's or father's brother.
example: Mi tío es divertido. (mi ˈti.o es di.βeɾˈti.ðo.) - My uncle is fun.

when_to_say: When referring to one's mother's or father's sister.
example: Mi tía vive lejos. (mi ˈti.a ˈβi.βe ˈle.xos.) - My aunt lives far away.

when_to_say: When referring to a male child of one's aunt or uncle.
example: Mi primo es alto. (mi ˈpɾi.mo es ˈal.to.) - My cousin is tall.

when_to_say: When describing something red.
example: La manzana es roja. (la manˈθa.na es ˈro.xa.) - The apple is red.

when_to_say: When describing something blue.
example: El cielo es azul. (el ˈθje.lo es aˈθul.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: When describing something green.
example: La hierba es verde. (la ˈjeɾ.βa es ˈbeɾ.ðe.) - The grass is green.

when_to_say: When describing something yellow.
example: El sol es amarillo. (el sol es a.maˈɾi.ʝo.) - The sun is yellow.

when_to_say: When describing something white.
example: La nieve es blanca. (la ˈnje.βe es ˈblan.ka.) - The snow is white.

when_to_say: When describing something black.
example: Mi gato es negro. (mi ˈɣa.to es ˈne.ɣɾo.) - My cat is black.

when_to_say: When describing something of considerable size.
example: Es una casa grande. (es ˈu.na ˈka.sa ˈɡɾan.de.) - It's a big house.

when_to_say: When describing something of limited size.
example: Tengo un perro pequeño. (ˈteŋ.ɡo un ˈpe.ro peˈke.ɲo.) - I have a small dog.

when_to_say: When describing something with a high temperature.
example: El café está caliente. (el kaˈfe esˈta kaˈljen.te.) - The coffee is hot.

when_to_say: When describing something with a low temperature.
example: Hace frío. (ˈa.θe ˈfɾi.o.) - It's cold.

when_to_say: When describing something recently acquired or created.
example: Compré un coche nuevo. (komˈpɾe un ˈko.tʃe ˈnwe.βo.) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: When describing something that has existed for a long time.
example: Es un edificio viejo. (es un e.ðiˈfi.θjo ˈbje.xo.) - It's an old building.

when_to_say: When describing something that requires little effort.
example: Es muy fácil. (es mui ˈfa.θil.) - It's very easy.

when_to_say: When describing something that requires much effort or skill.
example: Es un problema difícil. (es un pɾoˈβle.ma diˈfi.θil.) - It's a difficult problem.

when_to_say: When performing the act of consuming food.
example: Quiero comer pizza. (ˈkje.ɾo koˈmeɾ ˈpit.sa.) - I want to eat pizza.

when_to_say: When performing the act of consuming liquid.
example: Me gusta beber agua. (me ˈɣus.ta beˈβeɾ ˈa.ɣwa.) - I like to drink water.

when_to_say: When communicating verbally.
example: Ella habla español. (ˈe.ʝa ˈa.βla es.paˈɲol.) - She speaks Spanish.

when_to_say: When referring to existence or residing somewhere.
example: Vivo en Madrid. (ˈbi.βo en maˈðɾið.) - I live in Madrid.

when_to_say: When moving from one place to another.
example: Voy a la tienda. (boi a la ˈtjen.da.) - I'm going to the store.

when_to_say: When describing inherent qualities, identity, or origin.
example: Soy estudiante. (soi es.tuˈðjan.te.) - I am a student.

when_to_say: When describing location, temporary states, or feelings.
example: Estoy cansado. (esˈtoi kanˈsa.ðo.) - I am tired.

when_to_say: When possessing something or expressing age.
example: Tengo un libro. (ˈteŋ.ɡo un ˈli.βɾo.) - I have a book.

when_to_say: When performing an action or creating something.
example: Voy a hacer la cena. (boi a aˈθeɾ la ˈθe.na.) - I'm going to make dinner.

when_to_say: When expressing desire or affection.
example: Quiero un café. (ˈkje.ɾo un kaˈfe.) - I want a coffee.

when_to_say: When expressing ability or possibility.
example: ¿Puedes ayudarme? (ˈpwe.ðes a.ʝuˈðar.me?) - Can you help me?

when_to_say: When knowing facts, information, or how to do something.
example: Sé la respuesta. (se la resˈpwes.ta.) - I know the answer.

when_to_say: When knowing or being familiar with people or places.
example: Conozco Madrid. (koˈnoθ.ko maˈðɾið.) - I know Madrid.

when_to_say: When communicating something verbally.
example: Dime la verdad. (ˈði.me la βeɾˈðað.) - Tell me the truth.

when_to_say: When referring to oneself as the subject of a verb.
example: Yo hablo español. (ʝo ˈa.βlo es.paˈɲol.) - I speak Spanish.

when_to_say: When addressing one person informally.
example: ¿Tú eres de aquí? (tu ˈe.ɾes de aˈki?) - Are you from here?

when_to_say: When addressing one person formally or respectfully.
example: ¿Usted necesita ayuda? (usˈteð ne.θeˈsi.ta aˈʝu.ða?) - Do you need help?

when_to_say: When referring to a male person as the subject of a verb.
example: Él es mi hermano. (el es mi eɾˈma.no.) - He is my brother.

when_to_say: When referring to a female person as the subject of a verb.
example: Ella canta bien. (ˈe.ʝa ˈkan.ta bjen.) - She sings well.

when_to_say: When referring to a group including oneself (masculine or mixed gender).
example: Nosotros vamos al parque. (noˈso.tɾos ˈba.mos al ˈpaɾ.ke.) - We are going to the park.

when_to_say: When referring to a group including oneself (all feminine).
example: Nosotras somos amigas. (noˈso.tɾas ˈso.mos aˈmi.ɣas.) - We are friends.

when_to_say: When addressing a group of people informally (mainly in Spain).
example: ¿Vosotros sois de España? (boˈso.tɾos sois de esˈpa.ɲa?) - Are you all from Spain?

when_to_say: When addressing a group of female people informally (mainly in Spain).
example: ¿Vosotras queréis ir? (boˈso.tɾas keˈɾeis iɾ?) - Do you all want to go?

when_to_say: When referring to a group of people (masculine or mixed gender).
example: Ellos están aquí. (ˈe.ʝos esˈtan aˈki.) - They are here.

when_to_say: When referring to a group of female people.
example: Ellas son mis amigas. (ˈe.ʝas son mis aˈmi.ɣas.) - They are my friends.

meaning: You (formal plural / informal plural in Latin America)
when_to_say: When addressing a group formally, or informally in Latin America.
example: ¿Ustedes hablan inglés? (usˈte.ðes ˈa.βlan iŋˈɡles?) - Do you all speak English?

when_to_say: When counting or referring to a single item.
example: Tengo un libro. (ˈteŋ.ɡo un ˈli.βɾo.) - I have one book.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to two items.
example: Tengo dos hermanos. (ˈteŋ.ɡo dos eɾˈma.nos.) - I have two brothers.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to three items.
example: Hay tres sillas. (ai tɾes ˈsi.ʝas.) - There are three chairs.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to four items.
example: Tengo cuatro lápices. (ˈteŋ.ɡo ˈkwa.tɾo ˈla.pi.θes.) - I have four pencils.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to five items.
example: Son las cinco. (son las ˈθiŋ.ko.) - It's five o'clock.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to six items.
example: Hay seis personas. (ai seis peɾˈso.nas.) - There are six people.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to seven items.
example: Tengo siete años. (ˈteŋ.ɡo ˈsje.te ˈa.ɲos.) - I am seven years old.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to eight items.
example: Son las ocho. (son las ˈo.tʃo.) - It's eight o'clock.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to nine items.
example: Hay nueve libros. (ai ˈnwe.βe ˈli.βɾos.) - There are nine books.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to ten items.
example: Tengo diez euros. (ˈteŋ.ɡo djes ˈeu.ɾos.) - I have ten euros.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to one hundred items.
example: Cien por ciento. (ˈθjen por ˈθjen.to.) - One hundred percent.

when_to_say: When counting or referring to one thousand items.
example: Mil gracias. (mil ˈɡɾa.sjas.) - A thousand thanks.

when_to_say: When referring to the initial position in a sequence.
example: Es el primer día. (es el pɾiˈmeɾ ˈdi.a.) - It's the first day.

when_to_say: When referring to the next position after the first.
example: Es el segundo libro. (es el seˈɣun.do ˈli.βɾo.) - It's the second book.

when_to_say: When referring to the next position after the second.
example: Vive en el tercer piso. (ˈbi.βe en el teɾˈθeɾ ˈpi.so.) - He lives on the third floor.

when_to_say: When referring to the final position in a sequence.
example: Es la última vez. (es la ˈul.ti.ma βeθ.) - It's the last time.

when_to_say: When referring to an adult male human.
example: Es un hombre alto. (es un ˈom.bɾe ˈal.to.) - He is a tall man.

when_to_say: When referring to an adult female human.
example: Ella es una mujer fuerte. (ˈe.ʝa es ˈu.na muˈxeɾ ˈfweɾ.te.) - She is a strong woman.

when_to_say: When referring to a young male human.
example: El niño juega. (el ˈni.ɲo ˈxwe.ɣa.) - The boy plays.

when_to_say: When referring to a young female human.
example: La niña canta. (la ˈni.ɲa ˈkan.ta.) - The girl sings.

when_to_say: When referring to a domestic feline.
example: Mi gato duerme. (mi ˈɡa.to ˈðweɾ.me.) - My cat sleeps.

when_to_say: When referring to a domestic canine.
example: El perro ladra. (el ˈpe.ro ˈla.ðɾa.) - The dog barks.

when_to_say: When referring to the star that the Earth orbits.
example: El sol brilla. (el sol ˈbɾi.ʝa.) - The sun shines.

when_to_say: When referring to Earth's natural satellite.
example: La luna es hermosa. (la ˈlu.na es eɾˈmo.sa.) - The moon is beautiful.

when_to_say: When referring to a celestial body.
example: Hay muchas estrellas. (ai ˈmu.tʃas esˈtɾe.ʝas.) - There are many stars.

when_to_say: When referring to a woody perennial plant.
example: El árbol es alto. (el ˈaɾ.βol es ˈal.to.) - The tree is tall.

when_to_say: When referring to the reproductive part of a plant.
example: Me gusta esta flor. (me ˈɣus.ta ˈes.ta floɾ.) - I like this flower.

when_to_say: When referring to a large natural elevation of the earth's surface.
example: Escalé la montaña. (es.kaˈle la monˈta.ɲa.) - I climbed the mountain.

when_to_say: When referring to a sandy or pebbly shore by the sea or a lake.
example: Vamos a la playa. (ˈba.mos a la ˈpla.ʝa.) - Let's go to the beach.

when_to_say: When referring to a large town.
example: Vivo en la ciudad. (ˈbi.βo en la θjuˈðað.) - I live in the city.

when_to_say: When referring to a nation or state.
example: ¿De qué país eres? (de ke paˈis ˈe.ɾes?) - What country are you from?

when_to_say: When referring to the Earth and all its inhabitants.
example: El mundo es grande. (el ˈmun.do es ˈɡɾan.de.) - The world is big.

when_to_say: When referring to the general weather conditions of a region.
example: El clima es cálido. (el ˈkli.ma es ˈka.li.ðo.) - The climate is warm.

when_to_say: When referring to a season of the year or a transport station.
example: Mi estación favorita es el verano. (mi es.taˈθjon fa.βoˈɾi.ta es el βeˈɾa.no.) - My favorite season is summer.

when_to_say: When referring to the warmest season of the year.
example: En verano hace calor. (en βeˈɾa.no ˈa.θe kaˈloɾ.) - In summer it's hot.

when_to_say: When referring to the coldest season of the year.
example: El invierno es frío. (el imˈbjeɾ.no es ˈfɾi.o.) - Winter is cold.

when_to_say: When referring to the season between winter and summer.
example: La primavera es bonita. (la pɾi.maˈβe.ɾa es βoˈni.ta.) - Spring is beautiful.

when_to_say: When referring to the season between summer and winter.
example: Las hojas caen en otoño. (las ˈo.xas ˈka.en en oˈto.ɲo.) - Leaves fall in autumn.

when_to_say: When referring to the cardinal direction.
example: El viento viene del norte. (el ˈbjen.to ˈbje.ne ðel ˈnoɾ.te.) - The wind comes from the north.

when_to_say: When referring to the cardinal direction.
example: Vamos al sur. (ˈba.mos al suɾ.) - We're going south.

when_to_say: When referring to the cardinal direction.
example: El sol sale por el este. (el sol ˈsa.le poɾ el ˈes.te.) - The sun rises in the east.

when_to_say: When referring to the cardinal direction.
example: El sol se pone por el oeste. (el sol se ˈpo.ne poɾ el ˈwes.te.) - The sun sets in the west.

when_to_say: When referring to a diagrammatic representation of an area.
example: Necesito un mapa. (ne.θeˈsi.to un ˈma.pa.) - I need a map.

when_to_say: When referring to an instrument for determining direction.
example: Usa la brújula para orientarte. (ˈu.sa la ˈbɾu.xu.la ˈpa.ɾa o.ɾjenˈtaɾ.te.) - Use the compass to orient yourself.
